question: Who has clinched the 2018 men's singles Rogers Cup tennis tournament?
explanation: Rafael Nadal, a Spanish professional tennis player, has clinched the 2018 men\'s singles Rogers Cup tennis tournament at the Aviva Centre in Toronto, Canada. In the final, he defeated Greek teenager Stefanos Tsitsipas by 6–2, 7–6 to win his 4th Rogers Cup title. With this win, the 17-time Grand Slam champion Nadal clinched his 80th ATP World Tour title and fifth victory of the year.
